alert.note: Alert for Erie; Huron; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:11PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Huron, Erie and west central Lorain Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 810 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Sandusky to near Northern Milan. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lorain, Sandusky, Norwalk, Western Vermilion, Vermilion, Northern Milan, Milan, Wakeman, Berlin Heights, Kipton, Bloomingville, Sandusky South and Birmingham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
